title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Bates
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Bates - The New York Times
text:
Lewiston, Maine
The median family income of a student from Bates is $226,500, and 76% come from the top 20 percent. Less than 1% of students at Bates came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how Bates compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
